data.name: The Good Old Pig Latin : Reversed!
data.description: Remember Pig Latin? It is like this: If the word starts with a consonant, it becomes: ```"Pizza" => "Izzapay"; "Hello" => "Ellohay"; "Cheers" => "Eerschay"``` And if the word starts with vowels, it becomes: ```"Ohoy" => "Ohoyway"``` Well, this kata will translate Pig Latin words to original words. For the first pig latin category, in which the original word starts with consonant, you can only be sure of the original word, if the letter before the 1 consonant moved to the end is a vowel. like: ```"Ellohay" => "Ell" + vowel + "h"```. But other than that, it could be 1 consonant moved to the end or it could be 2 consonants. For the second category it could be either the original word starts with "W", or the original word starts with a vowel. In any case, you should return either the both possibilities in the result array in alphabetical order or the certain original word. N.B. Rest assured that no more than 2 letters are moved from the original word.
